title: Lakota dream of what was to be
desc: Looking down on Vancouver from Crown Mountain

divs.text: A long time ago, my father told me what his father told him.
That there was once a Lakota holy man, called Drinks Water, who dreamed what was to be.
That the four-leggeds were going back into the earth and that a strange race had woven a spider's web all around the Lakotas.
When this happens, you shall live in square gray houses, in a barren land.

And beside those square gray houses you shall starve.

- Ilehaka Stipa, Oglala Lakota Sioux, 1932
